title: --annonimize-date
body:
git annex now allows to specify the date for to be used while recording time stamp(s) within git-annex branch files.  It allows now to fake all the dates stored in the git/git-annex repo:

```shell
$> da=40; d0="Thu Jan 1 00:00:$da 1970 +0000"; rm -rf /tmp/test; GIT_ANNEX_VECTOR_CLOCK=$da GIT_AUTHOR_DATE="$d0" GIT_COMMITTER_DATE="$d0" datalad create /tmp/test
[INFO   ] Creating a new annex repo at /tmp/test
create(ok): /tmp/test (dataset)                                                                                                                         
2 10381.....................................:Tue 15 Aug 2017 01:33:12 PM EDT:.
hopa:/tmp
$> git -C /tmp/test log -p git-annex
commit 5af2c2a04319a362417250aef269002e25c1d356 (git-annex)
Author: Yaroslav Halchenko <debian@onerussian.com>
Date:   Thu Jan 1 00:00:40 1970 +0000

    update

diff --git a/uuid.log b/uuid.log
new file mode 100644
index 0000000..748db51
--- /dev/null
+++ b/uuid.log
@@ -0,0 +1 @@
+97b0f01c-d7eb-44ed-813f-7c0723fd8a90 yoh@hopa:/tmp/test timestamp=40s

commit 0096b601c565ac1efd2535363880ebe7c8f278e1
Author: Yaroslav Halchenko <debian@onerussian.com>
Date:   Thu Jan 1 00:00:40 1970 +0000
```

We are going to use it within the scope of heudiconv, but I wondered if we should provide interface to this functionality within datalad itself.

- pros: might come handy in other use cases where dates should be obfuscated
- cons: REALLY easy to shot yourself in the foot, so it would warrant at least some checks (that previous commit in git and git-annex has date(s) before or == etc)
